text:
Welcome to the world of Naruto! This is a world of action and adventure. Of Ninja and Samurai. Of hidden darkness and…aliens?

Whatever it includes, it begins on a continent composed of the Elemental Nations. Within most of these nations are special cities called Hidden Villages, which are run by Ninja, mercenaries trained to use the power of Chakra to perform superhuman feats such as enhancing speed and strength, manifesting the five elements, creating illusions, and much, much more. This is a world that is fraught with danger and conflict, though it currently enjoys a somewhat strained peace. Not for long, however. There are powerful forces stirring in the shadows. Hidden Sand and Hidden Sound are preparing for their assault on Konoha, and the Akatsuki have begun to move. You begin your journey in this world the day before Naruto’s graduation exam.

subcategories.name: Background
subcategories.text: The 100 CP perk of your background is free while the rest are discounted by 50%. Your age will be set to 12 upon your arrival but you may freely choose your gender.

options.label: Drop-In
options.description: You appear in your designated village with no new memories or relationships to help you. You are provided with a Village ID card and all standard documentation that will prevent you from getting a one-way ticket to Torture and Interrogation. You can optionally choose whether to be enlisted in your village as a ninja or if you enter as a civilian.

options.label: Genius
options.description: In a world of child soldiers it didn’t take long for your teachers to realize that you were a prodigy. Perhaps you come from a prestigious clan where you received special training, or you were simply born with talents and intellect that set you apart. Either way, your peers know that you’re something special.

options.label: Medic
options.description: This world is dangerous, and people are going to get hurt. That’s where you come in. You were enrolled in a medical training course while still in the Academy and you graduated with basic medical knowledge, enough to tend basic wounds, treat common poisons, and diagnose common ailments. Whether you use your medical knowledge to help or to harm is up to you.

options.label: Villain
options.description: The path to peace is not always sunshine and rainbows. In a war-torn world such as this, you’ve come to realize that the only true path to peace is through power. Power to manipulate. Power to control. Power to decide your own fate. You are free to choose whether you begin your jump in your village’s good graces or if you’ve already abandoned them to pursue your own ends.

subcategories.name: Gender
subcategories.text: Choose the gender you will inhabit during this jump.

options.label: Male
options.description: You arrive as male.

options.label: Female
options.description: You arrive as female.

options.label: Other
options.description: You arrive embodying another gender expression of your choice.

subcategories.name: Location
subcategories.text: Choose your starting village or roll to gain 100 CP.

options.label: Konohagakure
options.description: Konohagakure, or the "Village Hidden by Leaves", is the hidden village of the Land of Fire. Konoha is currently ruled by the Third Hokage and is hidden deep within a forest. It is generally seen as the most powerful of the ninja villages. Because of this, Konoha has enjoyed many years of relative peace and stability. Many Konohagakure ninja specialize in the use of Fire Release techniques.

options.label: Kumogakure
options.description: Kumogakure, or the “Village Hidden by Clouds”, is the hidden village of the Land of Lightning. Kumo is currently ruled by the Fourth Raikage and is hidden in a cloudy range of tall mountains. Many Kumogakure ninja use Lightning Release techniques.

options.label: Iwagakure
options.description: Iwagakure, or the “Village Hidden by Rocks”, is the hidden village of the Land of Earth. Iwa is currently ruled by the Third Tsuchikage. The rocky mountain ranges that surround the village provide a natural stronghold that it is very proud of. Many Iwagakure ninja use Earth Release techniques. Iwagakure is well-known for the rock-hard attitude of its shinobi; as soon as the Tsuchikage gives an order, the Iwa-nin follow it without hesitation, even if it means death.

options.label: Sunagakure
options.description: Sunagakure, or “Village Hidden by Sand”, is the hidden village of the Land of Wind. Suna is currently ruled by the Fourth Kazekage. Being surrounded by desert offers the village a natural deterrent against invasion. Many Sunagakure ninja use Wind Release techniques and relentlessly pursue victory.

options.label: Kirigakure
options.description: Kirigakure, or the “Village Hidden by Mist”, is the hidden village of the Land of Water. Kiri is currently ruled by the Fifth Mizukage. The village is shrouded in a thick mist and surrounded by mountains. Many Kiri ninja use Water Release techniques, and while its past is bloody, reform is underway.

options.label: Amegakure
options.description: Amegakure, or the “Village Hidden by Rain”, is a small but highly industrialized hidden village located in an unnamed country. Rain falls almost constantly and collects in a massive lake surrounding the settlement. Ame is frequently hired for assassination missions and secretly houses the Akatsuki.

options.label: Land of Iron
options.description: The Land of Iron is an icy, snow-covered country located among three mountains. Its military is composed of samurai rather than shinobi, and longstanding neutrality accords keep ninja from interfering. Diplomatic summits are often held here.

options.label: Free Choice
options.description: How about literally anywhere? Pick any location in the Naruto world as your starting point.

options.label: Human [FREE]
options.description: A standard human. Nothing particularly special, but it’s free.

options.label: Animal Summon [100 CP]
options.description: An animal companion that grows in power and size, gaining species-based supernatural abilities. Base size comparable to a normal specimen.

options.label: Animal Summon [200 CP]
options.description: As above, but you begin much larger—nearly the size of a small house, with significant physical might.

options.label: Animal Summon [300 CP]
options.description: A gargantuan summon rivaling Gamabunta or Manda, or a transformation to reach that size at will. Grants a discount on the Sage Mode perk.

options.label: Mecha-Human [300 CP]
options.description: Become a mecha-fied human with flight, modular weaponry, chakra absorption, and other machine advantages, but requiring repairs instead of natural healing.

options.label: Mecha-Human [400 CP]
options.description: All the benefits of a magic robot body with drawbacks nullified—heal and improve naturally while retaining all mechanical upgrades. Works with Hybrid for cyborg adaptations.

options.label: Zetsu [White, 400 CP]
options.description: A White Zetsu with flawless transformations, chakra-draining spores, and persistent parasite clones. Discount on Regeneration Kekkei Genkai.

options.label: Zetsu [Black, 400 CP]
options.description: A Black Zetsu with a malleable body, possession abilities, perfect sensory recording, free Chakra Sensing Kekkei Genkai, and Wood Release without prerequisites.

options.label: Zetsu [White & Black, 600 CP]
options.description: Half White, half Black—split into two autonomous bodies. Perks apply to both halves, and either can regenerate the other if destroyed.

options.label: Ōtsutsuki [800 CP]
options.description: Celestial being with overwhelming strength, durability, vast chakra reserves, enhanced Byakugan that reads fate, and Kāma-based resurrection.

options.label: Ōtsutsuki [1200 CP]
options.description: Ōtsutsuki who has consumed a Chakra Fruit—gain Rinnegan or Isshiki’s dōjutsu, flight, Yomotsu Hirasaka, and chakra reserves surpassing Jūbi Madara.

options.label: Hybrid [Variable]
options.description: Combine two or more races. Pay the full CP cost for each race plus +100 CP per additional race beyond the first two. Gains all racial traits and discounts.

subcategories.name: General Perks & Abilities
subcategories.text: Broaden your power set with chakra techniques, jutsu training, and other enhancements.

options.label: Chakra [FREE]
options.description: Begin with chakra reserves equal to an average Jōnin. In future Jumps you can awaken chakra pathways in others by channeling your energy.

options.label: Chakra [100 CP]
options.description: Start with chakra reserves comparable to an average Kage.

options.label: Chakra [200 CP]
options.description: Possess immense chakra on par with Kisame Hoshigaki, the 'Tailless Tailed Beast'.

options.label: Academy Training [FREE]
options.description: Graduate-level shinobi fundamentals: survival, stealth, trap-making, basic tools, three Academy jutsu, taijutsu forms, and chakra control for reinforced strength/speed and genjutsu dispels.

options.label: Nature Affinity [FREE]
options.description: Gain one elemental or Yin/Yang chakra nature affinity. Doubles affinity strength with matching dojutsu-based bloodlines.

options.label: Additional Nature Affinity [50 CP]
options.description: Acquire another chakra nature affinity (limit seven total).

options.label: Jutsu Technique [FREE]
options.description: Know any one E-rank technique at Academy graduate mastery.

options.label: Jutsu Technique [50 CP]
options.description: Master a D-rank technique (e.g., Body Flicker).

options.label: Jutsu Technique [100 CP]
options.description: Master a C-rank technique (e.g., Lee's Drunken Fist).

options.label: Jutsu Technique [200 CP]
options.description: Master a B-rank technique (e.g., Kurenai's Tree Binding Death).

options.label: Jutsu Technique [300 CP]
options.description: Master an A-rank technique (e.g., Chidori).

options.label: Jutsu Technique [400 CP]
options.description: Master an S-rank technique (e.g., Flying Thunder God). Over-purchasing adds mastery; prerequisites must still be met.

options.label: Jutsu Technique [500 CP]
options.description: Over-purchase to elevate a technique to S+ mastery, removing drawbacks and granting total control.

options.label: Anime Style [50 CP]
options.description: Toggle the aesthetic of each Jump to match any anime art style.

options.label: Ultimate Ninja Style [50 CP]
options.description: Make your techniques dramatically stylish without altering their power. Can extend to teammates.

options.label: Crafty [50 CP]
options.description: Learn to forge and craft mission-essential ninja supplies on the go.

options.label: Crafty [100 CP]
options.description: Produce items of commercial quality and build gear supporting any perk-based skills (e.g., puppets, medical tools).

options.label: Good Looking [50 CP]
options.description: Improve your appearance to a 9/10; does not include appearance change.

options.label: Good Looking [100 CP]
options.description: Become an 11/10 beauty with a free appearance change of choice.

options.label: Stings A Little [50 CP]
options.description: Gain significantly heightened pain tolerance, shrugging off punishment far better than average shinobi.

options.label: Stings A Little [100 CP]
options.description: Near-total physical pain immunity—torture feels no worse than a paper cut (mental trauma still possible).

options.label: Tsunade’s Strength [100 CP]
options.description: Possess immense raw strength: crack terrain with a finger, shatter Sannin, or breach Susanoo with a handful of blows.

options.label: Specialist [200 CP]
options.description: Acquire additional specialties or styles, each granting rapid mastery in the chosen field. Can mix focuses (e.g., Nin-Taijutsu).

options.label: Unsealable [200 CP]
options.description: Immune to sealing techniques; your powers cannot be suppressed or imprisoned by fūinjutsu (extends to other methods post-Jump).

options.label: My World [200 CP]
options.description: Total immunity to hallucinations and illusions, including Tsukuyomi and Infinite Tsukuyomi.

options.label: What’s Mine Is Mine [200 CP]
options.description: Your DNA is undecipherable and immune to cloning. Toggle to allow or deny access at will.

options.label: Hanzō’s Touch [300 CP]
options.description: Implanted with a lethal salamander venom sac; exhale targeted toxins causing agony and death within days, with antidote provided.

options.label: Supreme Kekkei Genkai [400 CP]
options.description: Encode any abilities into your genetics, ensuring they breed true (or under conditions you set) and combine into new bloodlines at will.

subcategories.name: Discounted Techniques
subcategories.text: If you have a specialization, you may discount any one jutsu within your specialization’s category. D-rank discounts make the jutsu free. World’s Greatest Medic-Nin grants medical/regeneration/reincarnation techniques for free.

options.label: Discounted Jutsu Technique [D-Rank]
options.description: Halve the cost of a D-rank technique (50→0 CP). Requires a specialization.

options.label: Discounted Jutsu Technique [C-Rank]
options.description: Halve the cost of a C-rank technique (100→50 CP). Requires a specialization.

options.label: Discounted Jutsu Technique [B-Rank]
options.description: Halve the cost of a B-rank technique (200→100 CP). Requires a specialization.

options.label: Discounted Jutsu Technique [A-Rank]
options.description: Halve the cost of an A-rank technique (300→150 CP). Requires a specialization.

options.label: Discounted Jutsu Technique [S-Rank]
options.description: Halve the cost of an S-rank technique (400→200 CP). Requires a specialization.

options.label: Discounted Jutsu Technique [S+ Rank]
options.description: Halve the cost of over-purchasing an S-rank technique to S+ mastery (500→250 CP). Requires a specialization.

options.label: Medical Technique Upgrade [100 CP]
options.description: Requires World’s Greatest Medic-Nin. Upgrade any medical, regeneration, or healing reincarnation technique to S+ mastery.
